fields.description:
h3. Summary
On a Jira issue, attaching a file with the "@" symbol in the filename will work, but linking it in the description or comment will not be rendered correctly. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Creat a file with "@" in the name
# Attach the file to a Jira issue
# Link the file in a comment on the issue: [^filename.extion]
# Preview the comment, or save it

h3. Expected Results
The file should be rendered as, 
{code} filename.extention {code}
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
file will not be linked and will appear as
{code} [^file.extension] {code}
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Do not use '@' in the file name.
fields.summary: A file with '@' symbol in the file name cannot be linked or rendered correctly

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Because of GDPR, user CSV export now does not include the username anymore. For example:

 [^Jira.csv] 

h3. Suggested Solution
 Replace the ID by GDPR-compliant information that would be more useful and user readable.
fields.summary: Include the email address instead of the ID for reporters and watchers on the CSV export
Update multi-user picker field via REST API V3 does not support accountId

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add user 'userA'
 # Setup Jira project in a way 'userA' does not have access to any (e.g. create single project and setup permissions for admins only + make sure 'userA' is not an admin) 
 # Login as 'userA' perform search, e.g:

{noformat}
assignee = currentUser() AND resolution = Unresolved order by updated DESC {noformat}

h3. Expected Results

Search returns no issues or/and gives more meaningful message
h3. Actual Results

Jira says 
{quote}
Field 'assignee' does not exist or you do not have permission to view it.
{quote}
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When user has no access to any project JQL search returns cryptic message

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Images attached with Jira Mobile iOS app have wrong mime type

h3. Environment

* iOS 12.2
* Jira Cloud by Atlassian App v80.0.0.613

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Take photos using iPhone's native camera app
# Attach photos taken to Jira issue with Jira Cloud by Atlassian App
# On Desktop, load the same Jira issue and click on thumbnail for image attached by app

h3. Expected Results

* Full size image is loaded

h3. Actual Results

Image preview does not load and has the message: 

{quote}
Ouch! We can't preview this file type.
Try downloading the file to view it.

Download
{quote}

h3. Workaround

Use desktop site to upload image attachments for now
fields.summary: Images attached with Jira Mobile iOS app have wrong mime type

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Attaching videos .mp4 in the comments via drag and drop to issues while using the new issue view cause to these videos be downloaded automatically when accessing the issue using Google Chrome in both old and new issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access an issue using new issue view
 # Start inserting a comment
 # Drag and drop a .mp4 video to this comment
 # Save the comment

h3. Expected Results

Access the issue without the video being downloaded automatically
h3. Actual Results

Access the issue using both old and new issue view, the video will be automatically downloaded.
h3. Additional Information
h6. Uploading via drag and drop in the old issue view
||Cause to test||Test to perform||Outcome||Additional notes||
|Chrome\New issue view|Access issue with video attached|Didn't download|(x)|
|Chrome\Old issue view|Access issue with video attached|Didn't download|(x)|
|Firefox\New issue view|Access issue with video attached|Didn't download|(x)|
|Firefox\Old issue view|Access issue with video attached|Didn't download|(x)|
|Safari\New issue view|Access issue with video attached|Didn't download|(x)|
|Safari\Old issue view|Access issue with video attached|Didn't download|(x)|
h6. Uploading via drag and drop in the new issue view
||Cause to test||Test to perform||Outcome||Additional notes||
|Chrome\New issue view|Access issue with video attached|Downloaded|(/)|
|Chrome\Old issue view|Access issue with video attached|Downloaded|(/)|
|Chrome Incognito mode\Old issue view|Access issue with video attached|Downloaded|(/)|
|Chrome Incognito mode\Old issue view|Access issue with video attached|Downloaded|(/)|
|Firefox\New issue view|Access issue with video attached|Didn't download|(x)|
|Firefox\Old issue view|Access issue with video attached|Didn't download|(x)|
|Safari\New issue view|Access issue with video attached|Didn't download|(x)|
|Safari\Old issue view|Access issue with video attached|Didn't download|(x)|
h3. Workaround

Upload the video using the old issue view. One of the easiest ways to achieve this is by appending the below string to the issue URL and then refresh the page:
{noformat}
?oldIssueView=true
{noformat}
fields.summary: Attaching video in the new issue view via drag and drop cause to be downloaded automatically when accessing the issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
According to the user picker field, a user can be searched and the user name or name of the user populates. However, populating an email address in a custom field is not available.

h3. Suggested Solution
Customers should have the option to have a custom field to search for users and populate the field with the email address.

h3. Why this is important
Customers would like to have the option to have a custom field to search for users and populate the field with the email address.
fields.summary: Introduce a custom field to populate the email address of a user
New view - Unable to insert format text if there is a hard break (shift+enter)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Searching for users on the "Assignee" field takes about 6 seconds to retrieve results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have about 10k users registered the instance. 
# Open any Jira issue and search for a user in the "Assignee" field.

h3. Expected Results

The list of possible matches is loaded instantly.

h3. Actual Results

The list of users may take up to 6 seconds to load.
 
h3.Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Assignee is very slow to retrieve users
Transitioning issue using REST API V3 without specifying fields wipes current field data.
Updating fields when transitioning issue via REST API V3 is not working as expected

fields.description:
h4. Problem Statement
When viewing the *favorite* item list, where favorited dashboards, filters, etc. are listed, it’s possible to drag and drop items to reorder the results.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

- A few specific users are receiving errors when reordering these results, saying *Something has gone wrong. You cannot drag items right now due to an error*
- Looking at the logs we could find that there was a *POST* request to /rest/internal/2/favourite that returned 400, but without any details about what was incorrect.

h4. Steps to Replicate
# Open Jira in two browser tabs
# In the first tab, open the star drawer, then close it
# In the second tab, open the star drawer and unstar an item
# In the first tab, open the drawer and you'll see that item still shows as starred (the data is stale).  Drag-and-drop a different item so that it is positioned directly above the now-unstarred item in the list

Expected Result
Be able to drag and drop items as the user likes.
Once an item is unstarred in one tab, it should synchronize and reload the favorite list in all sessions that are open for that user

Actual Result
User is not able to re-order items.
fields.summary: Unstarring an item breaks the favorite re-order functionality

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The customer wants to view/set backlogs based on individual projects.
 Example:
1. Project A
- Issue A-1
- Issue A-2
2. Project B
- Issue B-1
- Issue B-2

h3. Suggested Solution
Customers should be able to view/set backlogs based on individual projects.
 Example:
1. Project A
- Issue A-1
- Issue A-2
2. Project B
- Issue B-1
- Issue B-2

h3. Why this is important
Customers having issues being pulled in from various projects want the backlogs to be organized in the above-mentioned pattern.
fields.summary: Ability view backlog project wise

fields.description:
When users have more than 2 favorite/starred dashboards, they gain the ability to expand the dashboards navigation item which comes with a "View all dashboards" item. This cannot be expanded until 2 or more dashboards have been made a favorite for the user.

Without this UI element, there are no other blatantly obvious ways to find or search all dashboards.

The "Advanced Search for" dropdown does not feature dashboards.
and the ellipsis menu on the page of the dashboards is not intuitive when looking for other dashboards.

I would like to propose that the dashboards UI element be always expandable so that users can more intuitively find the complete list of dashboards, or that the Advanced Search for dropdown features Dashboards in the list directly.
fields.summary: find all dashboards easier for new users

fields.description:
Summary
 Whenever a JQL search uses the function changedby() and currentuser() and the name of the same user of currentuser() is used as a parameter, an IllegalStateException: Duplicate key <username> is triggered.

In order to reproduce run a JQL query like {{status changed by (currentUser(), "user")}} replacing {{user}} with the name {{currentUser()}} expands to.

In other JQL functions such as in(), this works.

Environment
 Tested within Jira Cloud.

Workaround
 None at the moment.
fields.summary: Using JQL changedby(currentuser(), <nameOfTheSameUser>) triggers IllegalStateException: Duplicate key <username>

fields.description:
When selecting a sprint for an issue in the new Jira issue view, the categories of "Active" and "Future" can be a bit difficult to distinguish. It'd be nice to have something that makes these be a bit more visible/differentiated.

!Screen Shot 2019-05-03 at 3.00.06 PM.png|width=349,height=236!
fields.summary: Better Differentiation Between Active & Future Sprints in Sprint Dropdown

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently , JQL operator "WAS" ,"WAS NOT", "WAS NOT IN" and "WAS IN" included with the current value. Mostly user would like to search issue that previously had the value but doesn't want to include the issue that currently has the value. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a new operator for user to search issue that was previously had the value but doesn't included issue that currently have the value. 

Or , change the WAS operator behavior. 

h3. Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: JQL operator "WAS" doesn't include current value

fields.description:
I'm used to having color labels in Trello but the company I work at is using Jira.  Please add ability to have color labels.  This should not be difficult and would make Jira much easier to use for grouping tasks and priorities.

 

Thanks,

Roger
fields.summary: Please add color to labels in Jira.

fields.description:
h3. Description
Webhooks that are triggered from comments added in the *new issue view* are adding undesired escaping characters (backslashes).

h3. How to reproduce
# Create a webhook that is fired upon an *comment created* event
#* This does not mean that other events cannot present the same problem
# In the *new issue view*, open an issue and add a comment that contains a '-' character, for an example
#* There may be other characters that are also escaped, but so far this was one of the only characters where this was noticed
#* Example of comment: *{{This comment contains a - character}}*

h3. Expected Results
As per [RFC-8259|https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8259#page-8], only some characters were supposed to be escaped. If the comment is added in the *old issue view*, the formatting seems to be correct. Below, a fragment of the JSON response sent by Jira:
* {code:json}
{
    "timestamp": 1556831811040,
    "webhookEvent": "comment_created",
    "comment": {
        "self": "https://<site>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/10013/comment/10038",
        "id": "10038",
        "author": {
            "self": "https://<site>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user?accountId=557057%3Aa9577981-6c9b-4442-94ac-4ef46a667ce8",
            "name": "lhubert",
            "key": "lhubert",
            "accountId": "557057:a9577981-6c9b-4442-94ac-4ef46a667ce8",
            "avatarUrls": {
                "48x48": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/ea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a?s=48&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D48%26noRedirect%3Dtrue",
                "24x24": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/ea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a?s=24&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D24%26noRedirect%3Dtrue",
                "16x16": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/ea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a?s=16&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D16%26noRedirect%3Dtrue",
                "32x32": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/ea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a?s=32&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D32%26noRedirect%3Dtrue"
            },
            "displayName": "Leonardo Hubert",
            "active": true,
            "timeZone": "America/Sao_Paulo",
            "accountType": "atlassian"
        },
        "body": "C:\\Path\\To\\A\\File\\This path contains a - that should not be escaped.txt\r\n",
        "updateAuthor": {
            "self": "https://<site>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user?accountId=557057%3Aa9577981-6c9b-4442-94ac-4ef46a667ce8",
            "name": "lhubert",
            "key": "lhubert",
            "accountId": "557057:a9577981-6c9b-4442-94ac-4ef46a667ce8",
            "avatarUrls": {
                "48x48": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/ea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a?s=48&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D48%26noRedirect%3Dtrue",
                "24x24": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/ea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a?s=24&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D24%26noRedirect%3Dtrue",
                "16x16": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/ea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a?s=16&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D16%26noRedirect%3Dtrue",
                "32x32": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/ea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a?s=32&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D32%26noRedirect%3Dtrue"
            },
            "displayName": "Leonardo Hubert",
            "active": true,
            "timeZone": "America/Sao_Paulo",
            "accountType": "atlassian"
        },
{code}
* In the old issue view, the '-' character was not escaped

h3. Actual results
However, checking the body sent by Jira, we could see that the escaping character (backslash) was also added before '-', which should not happen
* Fragment of JSON sent by Jira:
{code:json}
{
    "timestamp": 1556831798162,
    "webhookEvent": "comment_created",
    "comment": {

                "24x24": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/ea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a?s=24&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D24%26noRedirect%3Dtrue",
                "16x16": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/ea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a?s=16&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D16%26noRedirect%3Dtrue",
                "32x32": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/ea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a?s=32&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D32%26noRedirect%3Dtrue"
            },
            "displayName": "Leonardo Hubert",
            "active": true,
            "timeZone": "America/Sao_Paulo",
            "accountType": "atlassian"
        },
        "body": "C:\\Path\\To\\A\\File\\This path contains a \\- that should not be escaped.txt",
        "updateAuthor": {
            "self": "https://<site>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user?accountId=557057%3Aa9577981-6c9b-4442-94ac-4ef46a667ce8",
            "name": "lhubert",
            "key": "lhubert",
            "accountId": "557057:a9577981-6c9b-4442-94ac-4ef46a667ce8",
            "avatarUrls": {
                "48x48": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/ea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a?s=48&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D48%26noRedirect%3Dtrue",
                "24x24": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/ea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a?s=24&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D24%26noRedirect%3Dtrue",
                "16x16": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/ea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a?s=16&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D16%26noRedirect%3Dtrue",
                "32x32": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/ea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a?s=32&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fea634c9c4c16a23ddbc0fd8642cf616a%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D32%26noRedirect%3Dtrue"
            },
            "displayName": "Leonardo Hubert",
            "active": true,
            "timeZone": "America/Sao_Paulo",
            "accountType": "atlassian"
        },
{code}
** Problem can be identified in the response's *body* element, as the '-' character was escaped

fields.description:
It would be helpful, on Support Desk Tickets, to be able to set follow-up reminders and receive notifications on those reminder dates/times for tickets on which we are awaiting a client response. Otherwise, we have to control this flow in individual calendar events, which is hard to keep organized.***

*** This would then correspond to the need to be able to add/remove watchers (which we could previously do) for which I have opened JST-472449.

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Statement*
Comment is missing from the Batch Email Notification when Including a comment while assigning users

h3. *Steps to Replicate*
# Create a new issue
# Update the Assign to a user and include a comment
# Email should be sent out in a form of Batch Email

h3. *Expected Result*
Batch Email includes the Comment

h3. *Actual Result*

fields.description:
h3. Problem description: 
 * Not able to add group names with '&' character in the name as the workflow property value for property key: jira.permission.edit.group

h3. How to reproduce:
# Open a Jira workflow in edit mode.
# Select a status and goto 'Properties'
# in the *Add New Property* section, enter 'jira.permission.edit.group' for property key and any string with '&' (e.g., Charle & Atlas) as the property value.
# Click on 'Add' button.

h3. Expected result:
 # Property value should be added without any error.

h3. Actual result:
 * Error: *Invalid character: '&'*  is returned:

h3. Notes
User groups can be created with '&' in the name. So, it would be good to allow groups with '&' can be added to the workflow property value.
fields.summary: Not able to add workflow property values with '&' character

fields.description:
When Searching issues the drop down list of available field/columns only shows you the first few fields (from A to E only)... you have to guess what other fields are available.

Expected behaviour:
It should show list of available fields


Actual Behaviour:
Columns starting from 'A' to 'E' are only visible in the search.
fields.summary: Issue search returns column names (fields) starting with letter 'A' to letter 'E' only

fields.description:
*Summary*
- https://start.atlassian.com doesn't work on Internet Explorer 11.

*Environment*
- Cloud

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Open Internet Explorer 11
# Navigate to https://start.atlassian.com

*Expected Results*
- The page will load and show all the Atlassian applications the user has access.

*Actual Results*
- The page doesn't load and the following message appears: "Apologies, start.atlassian.com doesn't work on your browser". I have tested the updated version and others and got the same error every time.

*Workaround*
- Use Chrome, Edge or Firefox instead.
fields.summary: https://start.atlassian.com doesn't work on Internet Explorer 11

fields.description:
h3. Description
Mail handlers are processed in the same order they are defined in *Jira Settings > System > Incoming mail*.

Currently, it is not possible to reorder the handlers that are displayed there, so in a use case where a handler should be always left as *last handler* (i.e. scenario with multiple handlers that use *catch mails* and a handler without catch mails, which should be processed last), users cannot reorder the existing handlers if new ones are created.

h3. Suggestion
Add the ability to reorder handlers within that page, so that users can define the order in which they will be processed.
fields.summary: Add the ability to Reorder Mail Handlers

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When inputing a string value in a comment that contains a backslash "\" character before an "@" character the backslash is removed, this is impactful if attempting to input a file path as a comment where the file contains the @ character in the path exe: {code}\\127.0.0.1\path\to\file\@_in_pathname\example.txt{code} the \ before the @ is truncated

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud and Jira Server 8.1.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Type the following in a text field outside a code block and post, EXE: Comment on issue
{code}
\@
{code}

h3. Expected Results
comment displays 
{code}
\@
{code}

h3. Actual Results
comment displays only the "@" as the slash is truncated like the following which does include a backslash but will not render noting https://jira.atlassian.com is currently affected on 8.1.0:
 "\@"
 
h3. Notes
Does not affect other Special characters and seems to be limited to the backslash character speciffically "\", tested with:
{code}
` ~ ! # $ % ^ & * ( ) ; : ' " / . > , <
{code}
Text Entered:
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-01 at 12.12.43 PM.png|thumbnail!  

h3.Workaround
Add the string value to a "code" macro or "noformat" macro and the backslash will not be removed
fields.summary: using backslash and At "\@" character in string input to comment is truncating the slash

fields.description:
We use the "Sub-Task Blocking Condition" to block transition of a parent issue to Done until all Sub-Tasks have been marked Done, Cancelled, etc.

 

When this condition is triggered due to incomplete Sub-Tasks, the blocked "Done" transition button simply does not appear on-screen. To users who have forgotten or are unfamiliar with our process (sub-tasks must be completed first...), this looks more like a JIRA error than an intentional consequence of the users actions. 

 

Instead of hiding the blocked transition, please show the blocked transition as disabled on the screen. When the user hovers over the button or tries to click it, a tool-tip type message can display showing the reason the transition is blocked. ie, "All Sub-Tasks must be [selected Statuses] to transition this issue to [destination Status]."
fields.summary: Change "Sub-Task Blocking Condition" to show disabled transition & on-screen explanation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
*JIRA* option is missing from _Available Streams_ in *Activity Stream* gadget 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add *Activity Stream* gadget to the dashboard, or edit an existing one

h3. Expected Results
An option to select *JIRA* appears under _Available Streams_ 

h3. Actual Results
There's no *JIRA* option in gadget settings, and JIRA activity stream does not show up in the gadget. 

h3. Workaround
[Contact Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/]
fields.summary: JIRA doesn't appear in configuring options of the Activity Stream gadget

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Opening an issue from a board is working fine , ie the issue opens on a pop up window. However creating a subtask on this issue from a Business Project board fails when the subtask requires the create issue modal from the dialog issue view
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a required field to a subtask default screen
 # Open new issue view on a modal (from the board, for example)
 # Click on the "Add subtask" button
 # Select the subtask type that has the required field
 # Type something on the summary and click "Create"

h3. Expected Results

The create issue modal should show up, so users could fill up the required field and create the subtask
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens, you may see below exception is thrown in the browser console :
{noformat}
react-dom.production.min.js:17 Uncaught TypeError: this.createIssueFormFactory is not a function
    at t.value (view.js:177)
    at onSubmitClicked (view.js:101)
    at withAnalyticsEvents.js:104
    at Object.<anonymous> (react-dom.production.min.js:15)
    at Object.invokeGuardedCallback (react-dom.production.min.js:16)
    at Object.invokeGuardedCallbackAndCatchFirstError (react-dom.production.min.js:16)
    at T (react-dom.production.min.js:20)
    at N (react-dom.production.min.js:22)
    at M (react-dom.production.min.js:22)
    at A (react-dom.production.min.js:21)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Opening the issue using common Issue View will not have any problems with subtask creation , for example using the URL
 * https://<instance>.atlassian.net/browse/<parent issue ID>
fields.summary: Creating a subtask that requires the create issue modal from the dialog issue view fails when Project is of type Business

fields.description: In the _project role_ menu, we have the option to see the *usage* of the role per project. It would be useful, if we have this same option to check usage for groups, this way the Jira administrator could check the access of a specific group for each project.
fields.summary: Group usage - List of project permission per group

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Issue description disappears when accessing the issues without Logging in.

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
* Open Browser in Incognito mode
* Open url https://*sitename*.atlassian.net/projects/*projectID*/issues
* Choose the issues in the list. The descriptions will be intermittently visible and in visible
Please note: Make sure that the *browse permission* is set to *Group : Anyone* in the project

h3. Expected Result
Issue descriptions should be visible as expected
fields.summary: Issue description disappears when accessing the issues without Logging in

fields.description:
Created on behalf of a Community post:

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Register-Jira-Cloud-Webhook-with-REST-API/qaq-p/1062717]

I want to *register an JIRA Cloud webhook via REST API* (no connect apps). I have gone through the [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/webhooks/|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/webhooks/?_ga=2.231070872.601007769.1556540928-1581346095.1546457917]
 But it seems that it *only supports basic auth during webhook registration*.

What I want is to register an webhook with access token in header as 
 Authorization : Bearer <access_token>
 But when I do post it like above it always returns 401 status code.

Below is the configurations i am trying :

URL :
{quote} https://<subdomain>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/webhook
{quote}

 Headers : 
{quote}Authorization : Bearer <access_token>
 Content-Type : application/json
{quote}

 Body : 
{quote}{ "name": "my first webhook via rest", "url": "https://www.example.com/webhooks" }
{quote}
fields.summary: Allow tokens when creating webhooks

fields.description:
h3.Summary

As per, https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-67721 , it should now be possible to specify which issue security level to be monitored by the JIRA-slack integration. 

However, it seems that the drop down box to specify issue level is gone now.

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

This causes all notifications on issues with issue security level to fail. Irregardless of whether the said issue security level includes the 'atlassian-addons-project-access' project role.

h3.Expected Behavior

Being able to specify which issue security level to exclude/include in the slack notifications. 

h3.Current Behavior

Not being able to specify issue security level. Which causes all notifications on issues with issue security level to fail. Even if the said security level provides access to the 'atlassian-addons-project-access' project role, there will still be no notification.  Will not work even if you set to another security level that provides access to 'anyone'.
fields.summary: Slack integration with JIRA Cloud no longer notify users of issues with issue priority level

fields.description:
We move a lot of cards between projects, as we have teams working in separate next gen projects for our ongoing work. However, moving cards with custom meta-data, will lose all meta data when moving a card from one board to another. Only Jira fields are copied correctly. This causes problems, so instead we end up creating duplicates all over the place, not knowing which one contains the correct information.

It would be great if one could either match with fields of the same naming convention for instance Project1 > Requester == Project2 > Requester
fields.summary: Copying metadata between nextgen projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The "Clockify for Jira" add-on will display a link next to the issue-key of a ticket. This link does not appear if the ticket is open from the queue while using the new Jira issue view. 


h3. Environment
* New Issue View in Jira Cloud enabled


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install "Clockify for Jira" application.
# Go to a service desk project > Open a ticket from the queue.


h3. Expected Results
The link should appear next to the issue-key like this:
- This is on the old issue view:  !image-2019-04-30-15-39-53-053.png|thumbnail! 
- When opening the ticket in a new tab (/browse/issue-key) the add-on link appears: 
 !image-2019-04-30-15-42-00-066.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Opening the ticket from the queue, is missing the add-on link:
 !image-2019-04-30-15-37-55-201.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround
Disable new issue view.
fields.summary: 3rd party add-on link not showing on new Jira service desk issue view

fields.description:

All fields are displayed

Not for now

fields.description:

An Epic should not be closed when its stories are still open.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want the feature mark Epic as done available only after all the stories are done

fields.description:
Currently, *linkedIssues()* only searches for issues that are linked to an issue. It does not search at a project level.

It would be very useful if this capability is *extended to projects*.

Ex. Give me a list of all stories in my project that {{blocks}} other stories.

The jQL would look something like 
{{project=<your project> and issuetype=Story and issue in linkedIssues("blocks").}}
fields.summary: Enable linkedIssues() for projects for Dependencies

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The project description does not show up anywhere when creating an issue. This will cause confusion for some users as they create the issues in the incorrect project.

h3. Suggested Solution
When creating an issue, show the project description for the selected project.
fields.summary: Display Project description when creating issue

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Edit a workflow.
 # Select an arbitrary step and click "view properties"
 # Add a property with key "jira.permission.edit.projectrole" and a non-numeric value (this occurred for a customer with the project role name here, but any non-number will trip this.
 # Publish the workflow and view an issue in the status corresponding to the step you added the property to.

Expected result: you can see the issue

Actual result: 500
fields.summary: Setting a project-role-by-name permission -based property on a workflow renders projects associated with that workflow unusable

fields.description:
h3. Description
When editing the configuration of an *Issue Statistics* gadget within a dashboard, it is not possible to *uncheck* the auto-refresh option.

h3. How to reproduce
# Create a dashboard
# Add an *Issue Statistics* gadget
# Save the gadget
# Edit the gadget, check the *Auto-refresh* option and hit *Save*
# Edit the gadget, uncheck the *Auto-refresh* option and hit *Save*  

h3. Expected results
Auto refresh option is unchecked

h3. Actual results
Option is not updated


h3. Workaround
By default, this option is not selected when the gadget is added. Deleting and adding a new *Issue Statistics* gadget is an alternative to have this option unchecked

h3. Additional information
It seems that, for some reason, when the auto refresh option is *checked*, the request payload includes a value for *up_refresh*, which we believe defines the frequency with which the gadget is updated. 
* !Screen Shot 2019-04-26 at 7.22.30 PM.png|thumbnail! 

This, however, does not happen when the option is *unchecked*
*  !Screen Shot 2019-04-26 at 7.26.04 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Auto-Refresh cannot be Unchecked for Issue Statistics gadget

fields.description:
h4. Problem Summary

Whenever Jira changes between the old and the new issue view, *a conversion from Wiki Mark-up to ADF takes place*. When this happens *if the old issue view* had an encoded URL (example below) the URL will be encoded again, possibly causing the hyperlink to fail.
{code}
https://example.com/new%20example%20with%20spaces
{code}

The text you see remains the same, however, the HREF is encoded again.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Turn-off the *New Issue View* (switch available on personal settings).
# Paste an encoded URL (example below) in the Description or in a Comment body
#* {code}https://example.com/new%2520example%2520with%2520spaces{code}
# Save the changes 
# Turn-on the *New Issue View* and check the issue

h4. Expected Behavior

The URL is not encoded again, (since it is already encoded) thus still accessible.

h4. Actual Behavior

The *href* of the URL is double encoded. So the above example will redirect you to:
{code}
https://example.com/new%2520example%2520with%2520spaces
{code}

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Workaround

Copy the URL, paste in a plain text editor and paste it again in the issue (while in the new view).
fields.summary: Encoded hyperlinks from the old issue view are double encoded when switching to the new view (Wiki to ADF conversion)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Cloned tickets that have images on description shows "Failed to load" when using the new issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a ticket with images on description.
 # Clone the issue.

h3. Expected Results

The cloned issue will show the text and images on description.
h3. Actual Results

The image shows "Failed to load".

!Screenshot 2019-04-26_15-00-07.png|width=550,height=424!
h3. Notes

If we disable the new issue view and view the same ticket through Issues and filters > Search issues the image shows normally.

!Screenshot 2019-04-26_15-00-23.png|width=385,height=404!
fields.summary: Cloned tickets that have images on description shows "Failed to load" when using the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating a new user using the /rest/api/2/user REST API endpoint, an error message is returned for the email address and display name fields in the response body.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a test user by sending a POST request to [https://HOSTNAME/rest/api/2/user|https://hostname/rest/api/2/user] using below body:
{noformat}
{
  "password": "test2019",
  "emailAddress": "charlie1@atlassian.com",
  "displayName": "Charlie of Atlassian1"
}
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

The response body includes the email address and the display name like e.g.:
{noformat}
{
    "self": "https://HOST/rest/api/2/user?accountId=xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx",
    "key": "charlie1",
    "accountId": "xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx",
    "accountType": "atlassian",
    "name": "charlie1",
    "emailAddress": "charlie1@atlassian.com",
....
    "displayName": "Charlie of Atlassian",
....
{noformat}
h3. Actual Results

The below values are returned for the fields in the response instead:
{noformat}
    "emailAddress": "\"?\"",
    "displayName": "\"Failed to Retrieve User 557058:cb0ed084-e850-4535-ae4c-82a314c97e55\"",
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

When making the call again the right data is returned
fields.summary: Create user REST API endpoint does not return email address and display name

fields.description:
*Summary*
Administrators without Browse Projects permissions to a JSD project are not being shown a "This project isn't available" message when accessing a project from the "/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa" project list.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# be an Jira Administrators in an instance with a Service Desk project
# *do not* have Browse Projects permission for that project
# access https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa
# click on the project

*Expected Results*
You should be shown a "This project isn't available" message.

*Actual Results*
No message is shown, just a spinning circle.


*Workaround*
* Go directly to the project's settings clicking the three-dotted icon to the right of the project name.
fields.summary: Administrators without Browse Projects permissions on a project are not being shown a "This project isn't available" message when accessing a project from the "/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa" project list.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using markup to add strikethrough on a text, in the new issue view, it doesn't work on this view. If you see the issue in the "old view", the markup works for the strikethrough 

Steps to Reproduce

# Edit an issue using the new view
# Add a text and use the markup for strikethrough text, dashes (- -);

h3. Expected Results
The text between the markup should be made as strikethrough 

h3. Actual Results
Jira shows the dashes and didn't strikethrough the text

h3. Notes 
Using the old issue view, the markup works correctly

h3.Workaround
If you using the button to strikethrough the text instead of the markup, the strikethrough works both on the new view and in the old view
fields.summary: Strikethrough doesn't work using the markup in the new issue view

fields.description:
Google changed the way their groups forward emails when the sender has strict spf/dmarc policy - to be dmarc compliant, Google started rewriting the From: and Sender: headers and changes them to 'originalsender via google_groups_address'.

This is causing major trouble to the customers.

There should be a way to modify the mailhandlers to read 'x-original-sender' header and use 'x-original-sender instead the usual From and Sender headers.
fields.summary: Modify the mailhandlers to read 'x-original-sender' header

fields.description:
h3. Description
When copying an issue security scheme, instead of creating a copy containing the same security levels and their assigned roles/groups, Jira actually creates a blank copy of the scheme but adds the security level definitions to the original scheme.

h3. How to reproduce
# Go to *Jira Settings > Issues > Issue Security Schemes*
# Create an Issue Security Scheme
#*  !Screen Shot 2019-04-25 at 11.56.13 AM.png|thumbnail!  
# Create Issue Security Levels and define groups/roles to it 
# Copy the Issue Security Scheme

h3. Expected Results
A copy of the scheme, containing the same security levels and assigned groups/roles is created

h3. Actual Results
A blank scheme is created. The security levels and their definitions are added to the original scheme:
 !Screen Shot 2019-04-25 at 12.01.40 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. How to fix
Delete the invalid entries from the original scheme manually.
* To identify which entries are invalid, *right click* the delete button and copy the resulting link. The entries to be deleted are the ones where the *schemeID* is the id of the copy created.

h3. Additional notes
(!) This may cause duplicate security levels to be displayed when setting this field in issue screens.
fields.summary: Copying Issue Security Scheme Adds Incorrect Security Levels to Source Scheme

* The comma (,) is for quick field editing

But when viewing a JIRA issue, either one of them does the same thing. 

As per my understanding, the period shortcut should not show the list of fields. (that is the comma shortcut's job)

fields.description:

For some strange reason this JQL clauses :

When issues are created using the issue collector, the default issue security level is not assigned to the issue effectively making them available to all Users with access to the project.

h3. Expected Results
The new issue is assigned the default issue security level.

h3. Actual Results

fields.summary: Issue Collector does not respect "Default" Security Level

fields.description:
Atlassian’s [people directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/people-directory-939512608.html] is the home for user and team profiles in Atlassian Cloud. When you click on a user name in people directory, it shows some additional information about the user which is fetched from the user's Atlassian account in id.atlassian.com.

However, when you click on a customer's name who does not have an Atlassian account, the following error is reported: "Something went wrong
We keep track of these errors, but feel free to contact us if refreshing doesn’t fix things."

The error is confusing for customer's since nothing to be displayed here is expected behavior as there is no information to be fetched for customer's in this case without an Atlassian account. This is not an error and we should provide more information to the customer on this page instead of an error.
fields.summary: Show relevant message when trying to view Customer's profile in people directory

fields.description:
h3.Summary

As implied by the title, it is currently possible to create sub-task under the new issue view even when the issue has been set to be non-editable with status properties 'jira.issue.editable'.  This is workaround to prevent creation of sub-task on resolved issues since there is no status properties that prevents the creation of sub-task in a given status. There is an open ticket regarding this here : https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26208 

As the usage of this status property to prevent issue edit and sub-task creation on resolved ticket is very commonly used, it is important that the new issue view also follow the behavior of the old issue view for consistency. 


h3.Investigation Done

Before status properties is used.

 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

After status properties 'jira.issue.editable' is used. Notice the edit icon is gone and the menu also offers less choices than before.

 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

If you switch to the new JIRA issue view however, you will see that it is still possible to create sub-tasks. This is not possible on old JIRA issue view.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

As temporary workaround, you can disable the New Jira Issue View. To achieve this:

# Click the profile icon, on the bottom of your left sidebar, then *Personal settings*;
# On the "Jira Labs" section, click to disable the *New Jira issue view*.

*21/May/19 Update:* The assignee field is also editable in the New Jira Issue View, even if the status has the jira.issue.editable = false property.
fields.summary: Sub-task creation and assignee changing is not disabled by jira.issue.editable status properties in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the new Jira issue view, the *Text field (Multi-line)* custom field is appearing on the issue despite not having the custom field context applied.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a *Text field (Multi-line)* custom field. Configure the context to only applicable for 1 issue type, e.g *Tasks*.
# Have both *Tasks* and *Bug* issue type use the same screen.
# Create or browse an issue that is *Bug* issue type, the *Text field (Multi-line)* custom field will still appear in the issue view. However, it is only read-only as the field can't be edited.

h3. Expected Results
* The *Text field (Multi-line)* custom field should not show up in *Bug* issue type.

h3. Actual Results
* The *Text field (Multi-line)* custom field is appearing in the *Bug* issue type, but it can't be edited.

h3. Notes
This only affects the new Jira issue view. The *Text field (Multi-line)* custom field will not appear in the old issue view.
fields.summary: Text Field (multi-line) not respecting Custom Field Context

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

When a custom field with Select List (Multiple Choices) type chosen as _Statistic Type_, the total percentage is not 100% in total. Here is the scenario:
# Have a custom field with Select list (Multiple Choices) type
# Add a quite number of options (ie. 18 options)
# Create 2 issues (A-1 and A-2)
#* A-1: Only select a single option from the custom field
#* A-2: Select all options from the custom field
# Create a filter with this JQL: <Custom field> is not Empty > Save it as a filter
# Create a dashboard and add a Pie Chart
# Use the above filter and custom field as Statistic type.

Each of the option will have 50% percentage and *"Other* will be _400%_. 
*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Resolution

Make the total percentage to be 100% to avoid confusion.
fields.summary: Pie Chart gadget improvement when Select List Multiple Choices custom field type chosen

fields.description: It would be great that the issue view could be larger if the customer zooms out the screen. In the actual version, if the customer zooms out, the issue view remains a little narrow and the user can not take full advantage of the zoom out.
fields.summary: Issue view should be larger when zooming out

fields.description:
h3. Summary

We're seeing cases where media_store_id for attachments in issues (the ID that Jira service media.api attributes to files throughout Atlassian Products, i.e: Attachments) is being duplicated. When this happens, the new issue view (only) fails to load and throws an error in the network to help diagnosing:

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

The problem happens if the attachment with duplicate ID is added to the issue's description (and possibly other fields) in the old issue view, for example, using this: {{\!image.png\|thumbnail\!}} and is then shown in the new issue view.

If the attachment with duplicate ID is added to a comment, the issue opens, but no comment is shown, even the ones that do not contain the attachment.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
*We were not able to have the duplicated ID, but whenever it does*

# Have an issue with an attachment with duplicate Media API ID
# Add a thumbnail of that image to a description or a comment
# Try to load the issue in the new issue view

h3. Expected Results

Load the issue (we should handle the duplicated situation, or media_store_id shouldn't be a PK)

h3. Actual Results

*Attachment in description*
The issue doesn't load, it throws a UI generic error like:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

*Attachment in comments*
The issue loads, but we cannot see any comments. No error appears in UI, it just shows an issue without comments.

h3.Workaround

# Check the .event property from the error thrown, you'll find the filenames with duplicate ID
# Check the ticket in old issue view
# Download the attachment
# Delete the attachment from the ticket
# Add it back again
*This workaround resets the author (to you) and the date (to now) of the attachment. If this metadata is important to you, don't follow this workaround*

or 

* Disable the new Issue View (can Be done by adding '?oldIssueView=true' to the issue URL i.e: instance.atlassian.net/browse/ABC-123?oldIssueView=true // or by disabling it: Profile Picture -> Personal Settings -> Turn off the switch)

fields.description:
h3. Description
Currently, the filter search functionality does not allow users to search for an exact string. When typing in the *Filter Search* functionality, Jira will match all filters that contain any of the provided words.

h3. How to reproduce
# From the left panel, click *Issues and filters > View all filters*
# On the filter name field, type the string you want to search for

h3. Results
Not only the filter you typed will be returned, but anything that contain any of the words provided:
* !Screen Shot 2019-04-18 at 7.08.44 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested solution:
It should be possible to wrap the input in between double quotes to search for exact strings. That way, users who have a big amount of filters would be able to find exactly the filters they are looking for
fields.summary: Search for exact string in Filter Search Functionality

fields.description:
h3. Description:
When trying to search for an issuekey using Jira REST API and providing the issue key in lower case, it returns another issue.

It may return another issue if this issue was moved from another project and the original key was taken by another existing issue.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a project A and an issue A-1, for example
# Move the issue A-1 to another project B (key is change to B-1, but A-1 remains linked to that issue)
# Delete the project A
# Create a new project C with a different project key
# Create an issue C-1 (it must have the same issue number as the other one)
# Change the project key of project C to the same project key of the project A (now, that ticket becomes A-1, but that is also linked to B-1)
# Use the REST API to search for the issue A-1 in upper case (A-1), a GET to {{/rest/api/latest/issue/A-1}}
# Use the REST API to search for the issue A-1 in lower case (a-1), a GET to {{/rest/api/latest/issue/a-1}}

h3. Expected results: 
 * It is expected to return in both cases the same issue A-1
 
h3. Actual results:
 * When searching for the issue in lower case it returns the first issue (current B-1) that was moved to the issue B because the REST API search by ID and Jira maintains the id in the database pointing to the first issue A moved to the project B.

h4. Notes
This happens because the issue B-1 still has 'A-1' as key in the 'moved_issue_key' table in the database, while that is the current key of A-1, so both tickets resolve to A-1 and the behavior changes depending on the case (upper or lower).

h3. Workaround
* Search using just upper case.
fields.summary: Searching for issue using API may return wrong issue if lowercase key is provided

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When highlighting a text in the Add column dialog, the dialog collapses when the mouse click release is done outside the dialog area.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Jira search and expand _Columns_
 # Type any search string in the dialog
 # Highlight the text.
 # Release the mouse click outside of the dialog area. 

 !Screen Shot 2019-04-18 at 3.41.11 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The string should remain highlighted. 

h3. Actual Results

The column dialog will collapse. It gets problematic when the user starts typing in and then the Jira shortcuts kicks in. It's not unusual that the mouse click release will be done outside of the dialog area as the space is quite small. 

h3. Workaround

Release the mouse click within the column dialog.
fields.summary: Add column dialog collapses incorrectly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
*User Picker* fields changes are not reflected correctly in *Issue History* when the value is removed from the field. This affects both *Single User Picker* field and *Multi User Picker* field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a value to a User Picker field.
# Remove the value
# Check *Issue History* and the value still retains in the *New Value* column where it should be empty.
#*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* The *New Value* column should be empty after we remove the value for the field.

h3. Actual Results
* The *New Value* retains.

h3. Notes
The value is removed properly in the database. It's just that it's not reflected correctly in the *Issue History*.
This is also only affecting the old issue view. As a workaround, use new issue view and the *Issue History* will reflect the changes correctly.
fields.summary: User Picker fields changes are not reflected correctly in Issue History

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 14 October 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone, thank you for your interest surrounding this ticket. Before we begin [transitioning all users to the new issue view|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Transitioning-all-Jira-Cloud-users-to-the-new-issue-view/ba-p/1494104] on 31 March, 2021, we’ll be solving this problem. Watch this ticket for updates as we progress and please add a comment for any questions you may have.
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Whenever a Text (multi-line) field is added to the view screen it is featured in the *Description area* in Issue layout. Customers would like the option to move it with primary/secondary fields.

h3. Suggested Solution
Customers should have the option to move Text (multi-line) fields with primary/secondary fields. It should not be forced in the Description area.

h3. Why this is important
Customers would like to have the flexibility to move Text (multi-line) fields out of the Description area and place it with primary/secondary fields.
fields.summary: Ability to place Text (multi-line) fields with the primary/secondary fields

fields.summary: Show transition name on single-transition columns

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in the Sprint Report, it has *Issues Removed from Sprint* section which will display all issues that are removed from the sprint after the sprint is started. With this section, we are able to click *View in Issue Navigator* to get the list of issues and these can be exported.

But, for *Issues added to Sprint*, it doesn't have any section and it is only marked by an Asterisk * beside the issue key. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a section for *Issue added to Sprint* so that the users can click on *View in Issue Navigator* and export the issues that are added to the sprint after the sprint has started.
fields.summary: Add a section for Issues added to sprint in the Sprint Report

{quote}

View the issue details

*We couldn't connect to that issue*

fields.description:
Why? As a consultant company we are working always together with our clients over Jira and Confluence. Sometimes even over multiple companies with Jira and Confluence. As employee or project member it is always hard to stay up-to-date with my personal tasks over multiple Jiras. I need to login everywhere and check where and what has the highest priority. Sharing projects between one or multiple companies would reduce complexity for single project members a lot and also would enable a huge potential for further plugins and helps. 

 

Suggestion: Check also how Slack solve it over shared channels and see that each company can manage their own members and participate in a shared channel with the other company.
fields.summary: Share Project between Two Companies with Own JIRA Instances

fields.description:
h3. Description
Currently, when configuring workflow *post functions*, it is possible to update an *issue field*.  If the field updated is a User Field (i.e. Assignee), the user chosen to be set for the field is referenced by the *username*.
*  !Screen Shot 2019-04-16 at 10.56.14 AM.png|thumbnail! 

Due to GDPR changes, usernames are being deprecated from the application. Instead of using *Usernames*, the *Atlassian Account ID* will be used as the main identifier. (ref. [Say goodbye to usernames in Atlassian Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2018/06/say-goodbye-to-usernames-in-atlassian-cloud])

This identifier, however, may not be as human readable as usernames, for an example. Because of that, it would be nice if this particular feature displayed users' *Display Name* instead.

h3. Why would this be important
Using the Display Name in this feature would allow users to ensure the proper users are being set in their workflow post functions, as the account ID is not as readable as the display name.
fields.summary: Update Issue Field Post Function Displaying Full Name for User Fields

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update—26 May 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Today we have started rolling out a change that will allow you to resize images in the description and comment editor of the new issue view.

We will be incrementally rolling this out to users and expect all users to have access to this feature by early next week (Monday 1 June).

In addition to image resize there are other editor features bundled in this update including the ability to add status lozenges and dates, the ability to resize table columns, and the ability to add/remove rows and columns to tables by hovering and clicking the + or x that appears.
{panel}


h3. Summary

When attaching an image using the new issue view, it's not possible to resize and the image gets too big.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a ticket on a board.
# Attach an image in a comment.

h3. Expected Results

It will show a thumbnail the same as the old view.

h3. Actual Results

The image gets big, making the history complicated to read since the image fills a great part of the comment.

 !Screen Recording 2019-04-15 at 10.55 AM.gif! 

Here you can see how it looks when an image was attached using the new view and the old view.

  !Screen Recording 2019-04-15 at 10.51 AM.gif! 

h3.Workaround
Disable the new issue view by going to your profile > Jira Labs and then open the ticket through Issues and Filters and not in the board.
fields.summary: Images are too big when using the new and old issue view

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Statement*
At the moment, it is not possible to get a *daily reports of Logged in time* combined of a whole board.

For example an email that shows me like 'Currently on board ABC there was
34 hours logged in'.

h3. *Suggestions*
Ability to setup alerts that will get triggered when the combined logged in time is above X hours so that will help me to stay on top of the specific project where keeping track of
logged in time is crucial for the stakeholders, these alerts would help me to 
a) automate it 
b) stay on top of it without having to manually check that every day myself.
fields.summary: Trigger notification when time logged surpasses X amount of hours for tracking purpose

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!  !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!

Can add a thumbnail of the attachment to the comment

h3. Actual Results
Attachments are not showing in the comment:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a user with an expired session-cookie navigates to a Jira page ([https://<hostname>/secure/Dashboard.jspa|https://ckohler-jira.jira-dev.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa]) instead of being redirected to login they are presented with a 401 error page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an account that uses SSO.
 # Login
 # Manually edit the session-cookie to make it invalid(cloud.session.token).
 # Reload the Jira hime page.

h3. Expected Results

User is redirected to the login page.
h3. Actual Results

User is taken to a 401 error page.
h3. Notes (Optional - If Necessary)

This could possibly affect non-SSO users.
h3. Workaround

Clear browser cache and cookies then reload the page, this will direct the user to the correct login page.
fields.summary: SSO users trying to interact with the Jira after session expiry presents a 401 page instead of redirecting users to a login page

 resolution is EMPTY{code}

Thank you for your patience.

Arjoon Som

This means that on the Create screen, you're seeing a bunch of symbols (+,*,-,{) and need to rely on knowing the syntax and seeing the output after creating the issue or by changing the field to "view" mode.

*bold*
+italic+
{color:#ff0000}colour{color}
-strikethrough-

h3. Summary
In new issue view for macOs, when there are >8 status involve in the workflow.
Clicking on dropdown list for status does not allow to scroll down further.
Thus, unable to transition to a status that is after the 8th status

h3. Customer Impact

h3. Environment
* Mac OS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add more than 10 status in workflow
# In the new issue view, click on dropdown for status


h3. Expected Results
Able to view all status that is in workflow or scroll down to all status that can be transitioned to

Unable to scroll or view all statuses

Proceed to "Switch to old view" or turn of "labs" in personal settings where we can see the workflow dropdown working
Alternatively, it is possible to scroll by left-clicking and holding any status in the drop-down. You can then scroll with a mouse wheel or the arrow keys.

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

The *Import Issues from CSV* functionality accessed through the *search issues page* (see image below) won't allow the *assignee field* of the CSV to be filled as unassigned.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
+For instance:+
summary, issueType, assignee
summarytest, Bug, unassigned *(won't work)*
summarytest2, Bug, *(will work)*

Note: the *CSV* import functionality accessed through the *admin page* (see image below) allows it.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Suggested Solution*

Allow the *Import Issues from CSV* functionality accessed through the *search issues page* to accept the *assignee* field as *unassigned* and reflect the behavior of the *admin* CSV import functionality.

h3. *Why this is important*

Keep the consistency of functionalities behaviors. As we've checked that using the CSV importer from 
(admin only) external system import this same behavior works.
fields.summary: Import Issues from CSV functionality doesn't allow the Assignee Field to be filled as unassigned

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira Notification Platform breaks umlauts in notifications for some mail clients

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure you are using the new Jira Notification Platform
# Add a comment to a ticket with umlauts in the tite
# Notice the umlauts have been rendered incorrectly when the notification is received

h3. Expected Results
They are rendered just as previously before the new notification platform, for example this is the subject line of a working notification:
Umlaute äöü ÄÖÜ Mail


h3. Actual Results
 [JIRA] (MIBTST-31) Umlaute ñÂ äû£ Mail
 
See screenshots as well, as that did not copy as seen.

h3. Notes
I appreciate this also relates to the particular mail client encoding as it does not occur for example using Gmail, or it may even be language related. But if we can correctly render umlauts previously with the old notifications we should be able to do the same in the new.


h3.Workaround
Ask Support to disable to new Jira Notification Platform if it is causing you problems.
fields.summary: New Jira Notification Platform breaks umlauts in notifications for some mail clients

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the user has a dashboard which is used as wallboard and that dashboard has an Agile gadget on it, Jira will ignore the auto-refresh interval and the code will trigger refreshes every minute.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a dashboard which has the Agile gadget on it;
* Make sure to set the auto-refresh interval to none.
* View the dashboard as a wallboard.

h3. Expected Results
* The gadget is not refreshed.

h3. Actual Results
* The code will trigger a refresh every minute:

 !page inspection.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround(s)
* At this moment, there is none.
fields.summary: When viewing a dashboard as wallboard that contains an Agile gadget, the auto-refresh interval is ignored
